Module kivakit.core
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.logging

Interface Log

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.io.Closeable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.comparison.Filtered<LogEntry>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.io.Flushable<Duration>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Named
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseLog, BaseTextLog, ConsoleLog
public interface Log extends com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Named, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.comparison.Filtered<LogEntry>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.io.Closeable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.io.Flushable<Duration>
Accepts log entries for some purpose, such as writing them to a file or displaying them in a terminal window. Logger implementations write log entries to one or more Logs via log(LogEntry). Which log entries are logged can be controlled with filters returned from Filtered.filters() and by setting a minimum severity level with level(Severity). Some logs are configurable with a string-to-string property map via configure(VariableMap). Logs are also Closeable, Flushable and Named.

Wiki Documentation

For a detailed discussion of KivaKit logging, see the KivaKit logging documentation on the wiki.

Implementations

There are a variety of Log implementations, including:

  • ConsoleLog - Logs to System.out and System.err
  • EmailLog - Sends (typically high severity) log entries as emails
  • ServerLog - Makes log entries available to a client
  • FileLog - Logs entries to one or more files
Which log implementation(s) are used in an application can be selected from the command line with the system property KIVAKIT_LOG (see KivaKit logging documentation for details).

Configuration

  • configure(VariableMap) - Configures this log with the values from the KIVAKIT_LOG environment variable

Logging

  • level(Severity) - Sets the minimum severity level to log
  • log(LogEntry)
  • maximumFlushTime()

Logging

More details about logging are available in kivakit-core.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
